result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Erica Ann Pasterski

records.addlTxt:
2:04 PM Attorney Daniel Joseph Tombasco in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Erica Ann Pasterski in court.  Attorney Patrick Kiernan Cafferty in court for Erica Ann Pasterski. Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: Victim rights compliance. Attorney Cafferty is requesting a plea and sentencing date as the matter is resolved.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 13, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
WCS - Defendant is Compliant

02:20 PM   Attorney Dan Tombasco appeared for the State. Defendant, Erica Ann Pasterski, appeared with Attorney Patrick Kiernan Cafferty.  Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES:   Victim rights compliance. Attorney Cafferty is requesting an adjournment as there is a restitution issue he would like to discuss with the State. Also so Attorney Cafferty is requesting additional time to discuss resolution with the State as the most recent offer he received is different than the last offer made by the prior ADA assigned to the case. The State does not object. Court adjourns.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
WCS - Defendant is Compliant
re: Judicial Rotation on 8/1/22
Final pre-trial on August 29, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

02:50 PM  Attorney Alexander Huber appeared for the Prosecution. Defendant, Erica Ann Pasterski, appeared with Attorney Patrick Kiernan Cafferty. Victim rights compliance. Clerk: S.Shaw.
MINUTES: The parties request the 6/27/22 JS be adjourned to allow additional time to negotiate a settlement. Adjourment request granted. Final Pre-Trial set for August 29,2022 at 2:00pm.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
WCS Supervision Status Report.  In order to satisfy all the program requirements, the defendant must complete primary treatment.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Alex Huber appeared for the State.  Deft appeared along w/Atty Patrick Cafferty.  Defense counsel requests an adjournment; needs additional time for discovery/investigation.  No objection by the State.  FPT 6/6/22 @ 2:45pm, JS 6/27/22 @ 9am.
WCS Supervision Status Report.  In order to satisfy all the program requirements, the defendant must complete primary treatment.
